Exit polls from the Jan: 19, 2008, primary in South Carolina showed that John McCain narrowly lost to Mike Huckabee among self-identified Republicans, contradicting his claim of winning the majority of the Republican vote in the state.
Exit polls from New Hampshire also indic: with Romney receiving 35 percent of the Republican vote compared to McCain's 34 percent.
Several news agencies: including MSNBC, showed McCain narrowly winning among Republicans in their results from New Hampshire, but it should be noted that this contradicted the overall exit poll data.
The expert: s analysis concluded that there was no evidence to support McCain's claim of winning the majority of the Republican vote in either New Hampshire or South Carolina, thus ruling his statement as false.
